meanings.definition: The action of preordaining or the state of being preordained.
meanings.sent1: The preordinations of fate cannot be changed.
meanings.sent2: The preordinations for the event were set in stone.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her preordinations for the day included winning the lottery.
meanings.sent4: His preordinations in life seemed to lead him towards success.
meanings.sent5: The preordinations of the prophecy were finally revealed.

meanings.definition: The act of determining or arranging beforehand.
meanings.sent1: Careful preordinations were made to ensure the project's success.
meanings.sent2: The preordinations for the trip were meticulously planned.
meanings.sent3: His preordinations for the surprise party were almost spoiled.
meanings.sent4: The preordinations of the schedule made everything run smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The preordinations of the menu pleased all the guests.

meanings.sent1: Her faith was rooted in the preordinations of God.
meanings.sent2: The preordinations of the universe are beyond human understanding.
meanings.sent3: He chuckled at the idea of preordinations determining his every move.
meanings.sent4: The preordinations of destiny guided their paths together.
meanings.sent5: The preordinations of karma eventually caught up with him.
